alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:03PM EST until February 17 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR ERIE AND WEST CENTRAL LORAIN COUNTIES... At 1203 PM EST, Emergency management reported an ice jam on the Vermilion River at Mill Hollow and Bacon Woods Reservation broke causing flash flooding downstream in the Riverside Drive area of Vermilion. HAZARD...Flash flooding from an ice jam release is ongoing. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flooding of areas near the ice jam and downstream to the mouth of the Vermilion River. The nearest downstream town is the Riverside Drive area in Vermilion and is where flash flooding is ongoing with swift water rescues according to area emergency management. This includes the following streams and drainages... Vermilion River, Edson Creek and Brownhelm Creek. The flood wave is moving down the Vermilion River from Mill Hollow and Bacon Woods Reservation to Mouth of the Vermilion River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
